bibl.title: Letter from A. Connal to Frederick F. Russell, September 27, 1923

div1.p: Connal sends pathological specimens from another possible African yellow fever case. He thanks Russell for consulting with Noguchi and Darling concerning the previous case.

div1.head: Letter from A. Connal to Frederick F. Russell, September 27, 1923
div1.opener:
I. H. B.
Africa
Carter
COPY
September 27, 1923
Dear Dr. Russell:
div1.p:
I am very grateful for your kindness in sending me
the opinion of Dr. Darling and Dr. Noguchi on the autopsy tissues
from the patient Bradenelli.

I now send specimens of liver, kidney and spleen, from
a native named Garuba.

The clinical notes are not full, but they are the best
obtainable under the circumstances.

Examining the tissues myself I found in the liver what
I took to be an intense and advanced hepatitis with almost total
destruction of the liver cells.

The kidney showed the signs of glomerular nephritis
and there was no noteworthy change in the spleen.

I trust the specimens will interest Dr. Darling and
Dr. Noguchi and I hope you will be good enough to let me know
their opinion.
div1.closer:
Yours sincerely, (Signed) A. Connal. Dr. F. F. Russell
International Health Board
New York.
